inputs.text: [gentle] There's a moment in your field journal - day 27 - that really struck me. Can you talk about what happened?
[long pause] [exhales] Yeah. [soft] That's... that's the day I'll remember forever.

[thoughtful] So I'd been documenting Cosmos for almost four weeks. Same time every day, same careful approach, same respectful distance. Professional distance, right? [short pause] I'm a scientist, he's my research subject. But on day 27, I descended to my usual spot about fifteen feet from his fortress. I settled in, turned on my camera, and Cosmos emerged. [pause] But this time, he came toward me. Not hunting behavior. Not threat display. Just... [whispers] approached.
[whispers] Two feet from my camera lens. Close enough that I could see EVERY detail. [inhales] And then he looked directly into my lens. Not at the camera as an object. Into it. [pause] At me.

[emotional] Terrifying and beautiful at the same time. Every instinct said maintain scientific distance. Every protocol said don't interact. But Mark... [pause] he was LOOKING at me. His skin shifted to calm colors. His arms relaxed. And one arm extended slightly - not touching, just... [soft] reaching. Like he was saying hello.

[emotional] Maybe. Maybe saying: I see you. You've been watching me build my home. You've been here for this journey. [pause] And then after about thirty seconds, he withdrew to his fortress, and I surfaced. [voice breaking slightly] And I cried into my mask the whole way up.
